intro: Ononis pseudocintrana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal or arid environments. Its adaptations to harsh conditions make it a resilient species in its native habitat.
